boat.construction_details: Iroko planks on laminated Iroko frames
boat.full_description:
Ostrea Rose was built in 1980 to a design evolved from the bawley design Josiah Pitt who moved from Leigh to Maldon in the 1870s.

She worked comercially on the River Blackwater for 3 years, catching oysters for the "Maldon Oyster Fishery". After this she was converted to a yacht, working for a while as a charter boat, taking up to 5 guests in an interior fitted "in the Edwardian style".

By 2010 she was based in the Netherlands.

Log 89/3, Au/93. Jun 2010 log for sale p. 49
boat.name: Ostrea Rose
boat.short_description: Ostrea Rose is a hybrid smack/bawley, that dredged oysters comercially up until 1984 with the fishing number MN183
